DOC.brief_summary: Can improve diabetes outcomes 1 ) report card mail patient 2 ) point care distribution report card patient 3 ) provider performance feedback patient level data ?
DOC.brief_title: Automated Diabetes Registry Tools Enhance Patient Self-Management Provider Performance Feedback
DOC.detailed_description: Our federally qualify health care center serve 7000 diabetic patient , many uninsured ( 43 % ) medicaid ( 18 % ) medicare ( 26 % ) . The population 54 % Latino , 25 % Caucasian , 14 % African American . We exclude patient old 75 ; without English Spanish first language ; homeless . The remain 5457 patient randomize one-year study end January 1 , 2009 . One-half enrol patient receive quarterly mail report card HgA1c , blood pressure , lipid performance . They ask pick list self-management goal see provider last visit 2 month prior mail . In 2x2 design , eight clinic randomize ) on-site printing patient report card on-site printing ii ) standard provider performance report card enhance provider report card . The standard provider report card include data provider performance HgA1c , LDL , blood pressure compare provider . The enhanced provider report card also include list 10 patient HgA1c , LDL , blood pressure goal . The provider report card distribute quarterly basis , point care patient report card distribute every clinic visit . We analyze impact intervention percent patient expert recommended goal glycemic , lipid , blood pressure control . We also perform qualitative analysis describe provider patient attitude toward intervention .
DOC.criteria: icd9 code diabetes primary care visit past 18 month English Spanish primary language age 75 No working address
